lead_paragraph: Bilal Abood, 37, a naturalized American citizen, was charged with lying to an F.B.I. agent after he denied that he had pledged loyalty to the head of the Islamic State.

headline.print_headline: Iraqi Who Worked for the U.S. Military Is Arrested in Texas in Link to Islamic State
headline.main: Iraqi Who Worked for the U.S. Military Is Arrested in Texas in Link to Islamic State

snippet: Bilal Abood, 37, a naturalized American citizen, was charged with lying to an F.B.I. agent after he denied that he had pledged loyalty to the head of the Islamic State.
abstract: Bilal Abood, Iraqi man who moved to America after working as translator for United States forces, is arrested by FBI agents; Abood is accused of pledging allegiance to the leader of the Islamic State and misleading agents about travels in Syria.
